definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Hume referred to the latter type of axioms as "self-evident" truths.
sentences.chinese: 休謨提到的“不言自明的”真理公理後一種類型。

sentences.english: It used to be axiomatic in advertising that no one paid for mixed messages.
sentences.chinese: 這曾經是不言自明的，沒人會爲混合的信息買賬。

sentences.english: But don't think that all of this is obvious to everyone.
sentences.chinese: 但不要錯認爲所有這些內容對每個人都是不言自明的。

sentences.english: Achieving energy efficiency sounds like a self-evident goal.
sentences.chinese: 提高能源效率聽起來是一個不言自明的目標。

sentences.english: This sounds like a no-brainer, but it still bears repeating.
sentences.chinese: 這似乎是不言自明的，但仍然需要反覆提醒。

sentences.english: This troth seems to be self-evident.
sentences.chinese: 這的確似乎是不言自明的。

sentences.english: The entries in that section should be self-explanatory.
sentences.chinese: 該部分中的條目不言自明。

sentences.english: There is no question who hasbeen the cannier politician.
sentences.chinese: 到底誰精明，不言自明瞭。

sentences.english: The rest of the methods are fairly self-explanatory.
sentences.chinese: 其餘方法基本是不言自明的。

sentences.english: I think the answer is self-evident.
sentences.chinese: 我想，答案是不言自明的。

sentences.english: The harm of such a phenomenon is self-evident .
sentences.chinese: 這種現象的害處是不言自明的。

sentences.english: Make input easy to prepare and outputself-explanatory.
sentences.chinese: 爲輸入做好準備，使輸出可以不言自明。

sentences.english: The import package header in the manifest is fairly self-explanatory.
sentences.chinese: 清單中的導入程序包頭是相當不言自明的。

sentences.english: He didn’t explain why, but he didn’t have to.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有解釋爲什麼，但答案不言自明。

definition: it goes without saying/it is self-evident
clearly and easy to see (idiom); obviously/clearly/it goes without saying
unspoken implication (idiom)/the actual meaning of what was said
to contain in a concealed form/to keep covered up/implicit
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
lit. ready to appear at the call (idiom)/fig. on the verge of coming out into the open/(of a person's choice etc) on the point of being disclosed/(of an artistic depiction) vividly portrayed
meaning/implication/flavor/overtone/to mean/to imply/(Tw) to get a sense of
